public abstract class

SearchCallback

extends Object
java.lang.Object
   ↳ com.google.android.apps.auto.sdk.SearchCallback

Class Overview

Callback for search events. The app should handle these events, especially onSearchTextChanged(String), and set a new set of search items using the SearchController.

Summary

Public Constructors
SearchCallback()
Public Methods
abstract void onSearchItemSelected(SearchItem searchItem)
Called when the user selects a search item.
void onSearchStart()
Called when the user launches the search screen, either through keyboard or voice.
void onSearchStop()
Called when the user leaves the search screen, either by selecting a search result or by clicking the X button.
abstract boolean onSearchSubmitted(String searchTerm)
Called when the user submits the search term, either by pressing the Search button on the keyboard, or by pressing Enter (depends on the keyboard type and head unit configuration).
abstract void onSearchTextChanged(String searchTerm)
Called when there is a new search request by the user to get back the list of new search items.

Public Constructors

public SearchCallback ()

Public Methods

public abstract void onSearchItemSelected (SearchItem searchItem)

Called when the user selects a search item.

Parameters
searchItem SearchItem: The selected search item.

public void onSearchStart ()

Called when the user launches the search screen, either through keyboard or voice.

public void onSearchStop ()

Called when the user leaves the search screen, either by selecting a search result or by clicking the X button. Changing facet does NOT leave the search screen.

public abstract boolean onSearchSubmitted (String searchTerm)

Called when the user submits the search term, either by pressing the Search button on the keyboard, or by pressing Enter (depends on the keyboard type and head unit configuration).

Parameters
searchTerm String: The final search term. To be notified every time the user changes the search term, use onSearchTextChanged(String).
Returns
boolean True to indicate that the search result screen is displayed by the App. False to use the default search results page with the existing results. The App can still update the search results list if needed.

public abstract void onSearchTextChanged (String searchTerm)

Called when there is a new search request by the user to get back the list of new search items. For example, this is called when the user types a new character into the search box.

Parameters
searchTerm String: The search term, which can be empty when on start (in which case the app should provide a list of search suggestions). This search term may be an incomplete query since the user hasn't submitted the search yet. To get the final search term, listen to onSearchSubmitted(String).
